paper_abstract: We study the Hamilton cycle Maker-Breaker game, played on the edges of the random graph G(n, p). We prove a conjecture from (Stojakovic and Szabo, Random Struct and Algorithms 26 (2005), 204-223.). asserting, that the property that Maker is able to win this game, has a sharp threshold at logn/n. Our theorem can be considered a game-theoretic strengthening of classical results from the theory of random graphs: not only (foes G(n, p) almost surely admit a Hamilton cycle for p = (1 + epsilon)logn/n but Maker is able to build One while playing against an adversary. (D 2008 Wiley Periodicals. Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 34, 112-122. 2009
paper_title: A Sharp Threshold for the Hamilton Cycle Maker-Breaker Game
